issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
In a topology where OSG is separate from CLC instances fail to launch. OSG throws PUT operation fails due to NPE

\[CLC\]
\[ OSG WS CC00 SC00\]
\[NC00\]

fields.summary: PUT operation fails with NPE when OSG is separate from CLC

comments.body: Yep, I knew this was going to happen. I have a fix in progress.

The fix is to use the AWS Java SDK as the OSGs don't support internal SOAP-based PUTs from remote hosts. The NPE is caused by a failure to marshall the content stream on the source.

The broader fix is to always use an S3 client for object-storage access to ensure that we hit the REST pipeline and get consistent operations each time. My fix also modifies all other places in the CLC that use the internal message dispatch to do S3 operations. They are replaced by a utility client "EucaS3Client" that wraps the AmazonS3Client and allows easy access to object-storage from other components.

Fix is same as for euca-8877. Now using S3 SDK-based client that will work regardless of component topology. Verified on my cluster with remote OSG+Walrus from CLC.

Internal commit: 6786cef701a00a701b41c87dd51f73af85492c04
Eucalyptus commit: 68266c8af98bc4fb62c296453ff3fe671934f1dc

Fix verified.

Instances launch successfully (download bundle succeeds) in a topology where CLC is separate from OSG.

Installed Packages
Name        : eucalyptus
Arch        : x86_64
Version     : 4.0.0
Release     : 0.0.747.20140326git7c137674.el6
